fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37944].
  {panel}

Hi,

With the current default Excel file that you can get from an export (I download min. 3 different list a week), if you want to play with the data in Excel (i.e. via pivot table), you have to clearly specify the range of the pivot table.

The quick link (just selecting one cell and clicking on pivot table) doesn't work.

The automatic header and the automatic footer that are collated to the data prevent Excel from detecting correctly the headers of the column.

A very simple way to avoid this (that I do in my local instance) is to just add one empty line after the header, and one empty line before the footer.

Could you integrate this in the default template for the Excel export ?
fields.summary: Enhance Excel export for easier usage with pivot tables
Drag and drop emails for OnDemand

Could not parse gadget spec at : <<my gadget link in confluence.confluence-page-gadget.xml>>

fields.description:
If the number field display format has been altered as per this page : [How to display a different format for the Number customfield|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/How+to+display+a+different+format+for+the+Number+customfield] then decimal point values are not displayed correctly in issues. However it is displayed correctly in issue edit screen.

*Steps to reproduce :*
# Use the instructions here : [How to display a different format for the Number customfield|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/How+to+display+a+different+format+for+the+Number+customfield] to change the format of Number type custom fields.
# Now open an issue and add Number field custom field value to a decimal value for example : 1.7
# Notice that on the issue this field is displayed as 1.
# Open the issue for edit and notice that the value is displayed correctly.
 
*Workaround*
Revert back the changes made as per this page : [How to display a different format for the Number customfield|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/How+to+display+a+different+format+for+the+Number+customfield]
fields.summary: Number field in decimal not displayed correctly on issues

fields.description:
Hi everyone,

I'm currently facing a problematic of non parsing incoming mail to jira.
Mail handler configuration was done and it worked for weeks without any problems. I encountered a problem with a first mail and then all following ones are not correctly parsed. Issue is created, subject is correctly set but the description contains the mail header, as raw data (attached screenshots)

I tried restarting jira, we deleted the mail handler and recreated it and none worked so far. We were not able to reproduce that problematic on the test environment that features the same jira setup and configuration. Both servers use the same mail server but different accounts.

In the logs, not much I'm afraid, we once had a :
com.sun.mail.util.DecodingException: BASE64Decoder: Error in encoded stream: needed at least 2 valid base64 characters, but only got 1 before padding character (=), the 10 most recent characters were: "peg; name="
                at com.sun.mail.util.BASE64DecoderStream.decode(BASE64DecoderStream.java:266)
                at com.sun.mail.util.BASE64DecoderStream.read(BASE64DecoderStream.java:144)
                at java.io.FilterInputStream.read(FilterInputStream.java:107)
                at javax.activation.DataHandler.writeTo(DataHandler.java:308)
                at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.AbstractMessageHandler.getFileFromPart(AbstractMessageHandler.java:1182)

I'm attaching the atlassian-jira.log if that helps.

I'm currently asking for recommendations and your assistance. 

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Mail handler parsing problem

Given the following JIRA issue: "FLIC-8" with summary "Add/remove customers".
The "Create branch" link for that issue opens the following page:
https://bitbucket.org/branch/create?issueKey=FLIC-8&issueType=Sub-task&issueSummary=Add%2Fremove+customers
Bitbucket generates the following branch name for this: FLIC-8-addremove-customers.
I think the forward slash should be replaced with a + in the url so bitbucket resolves it to add-remove-customers.
fields.summary: Replace issue summary forward slash with dash when creating branch from JIRA ticket.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using IE 8 or 9, access a JIRA issue while logged-in as a user that doesn't have 'Manage Watchers' permission for the issue's project.
# Click the watchers button, to attempt to add a watcher.

h3. Expected Results
You should get a screen which doesn't give you a prompt to Add Watchers.
!ok.PNG!

h3. Actual Results
* In IE 8 or 9, you get the following instead prompting to Add Watchers
* Also the dialog appears to be a bit broken as some text is visible saying 'false', and the box drops below a bit as can be seen on the screenshot below.
!IEWatcher.PNG!

Note that although you get the dialog to add to or edit the watchers list, the permission works correctly as it doesn't allow you to modify the watchers list. You get an appropriate error as the following if you try to do so.
!permission.PNG|width=100%!
fields.summary: IE 8 & 9 shows broken 'Add Watcher' dialog to users without Manage Watchers permission in Issue View

h3. Summary
Searching for issues assigned to or reported by inactive user is not possible in basic mode. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Assign an issue to userA
# Make userA inactive (uncheck the Active box) 
# Using Basic mode, search the Assignee > userA
# Switch to Advanced Mode, search with JQL {{Assignee = 'userA'}}

h3. Expected Results
In Basic mode, userA is not available in the drop-down option

h3. Actual Results
UserA is searchable in Basic mode
 

h3.Solution / Workaround
* Make user Active when running the search in Basic mode
* If we know exact username we can enter it in *Advanced Search* mode in spite of username is not suggested.
fields.summary: Searching for issues assigned to or reported by inactive user is not possible in basic mode

fields.description:
I have encountered with a database exception, while I have been waiting forward redirection from the custom database settings page. The exact exception is as fallows.

org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT pluginkey, pluginenabled FROM pluginstate (Table 'jira.pluginstate' doesn't exist) 

It's a new installation on Ubuntu 12.04.4 LTS from atlassian-jira-6.2.2-bundle-x64.bin bundle performed as stated in this manual https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+JIRA+on+Linux. The database is MySQL Server 5.5.35.

By sixth sense I've renamed the pluginversion table to pluginstate as it's with compatible columns. That resolved the issue. Probably it's an incompatibility issue between a sql creation script contained within the bundle and the code base.
fields.summary: Table 'jira.pluginstate' doesn't exist

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37914].
  {panel}

Symptoms:

JIRA is running behind a proxy that requires basic auth headers for all requests. Portions of the UI (primarily gadgets) are not loading / throwing errors.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Go to JIRA and log out.
2. Open up the Chrome the developer toolbox and look at the network tab
3. Update the URL to fit this format: http://127.0.0.1:8080/secure/Dashboard.jspa?os_authType=basic
4. Load the page, and complete authentication

Desired:

JIRA will use the auth credentials for all requests being made.

Actual:

Only some resources are requested with the correct auth information in the headers.

In most scenarios, the Actual behavior is fine because a session cookie is now in place. However, this is not enough in environments that require auth headers for every request.
fields.summary: Abillity to force usage of auth header consistently across all requests

fields.description:
When gadget is maximised request parameter containing spaces (actually + symbol) e.g. targetGroup=Media+and+Messaging+Media+Platforms, becomes incorrectly encoded, e.g. targetGroup=Media%2Band%2BMessaging%2BMedia%2BPlatforms

Problem is originally reported with jira-timesheet-plugin gadget option that allows to select jira group. Option value (gadget preference value) is group name in the case and is stored in literal. I was not able to find JIRA standard gadget with similar case.

Steps to reproduce.

Prerequisites: 
1. JIRA group containing spaces, e.g. Media and Messaging Media Platforms
2. Time Sheet gadget on dashboard from jira-timesheet-plugin

Scenario:
1. Configure gadget, see 'Show summary for users in groups' option and select group containing spaces
2. Open developer tools in browser and see gadget request, e.g.: http://localhost/jira/rest/timesheet-gadget/1.0/timesheet.json?targetGroup=Media+and+Messaging+Media+Platforms
3. Click maximize, and see request having incorrect parameter: http://localhost/jira/rest/timesheet-gadget/1.0/timesheet.json?targetGroup=Media%2Band%2BMessaging%2BMedia%2BPlatforms

Expected: the same request parameter value as before maximising gadget.

Note, that having + sign in group name does not get incorrectly encoded when maximising.
fields.summary: Gadget preference value containing spaces gets corrupted

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37908].
  {panel}

Activity Stream can generate more than 12K bytes of URL request. This obviously will throws error like ERROR 414 Request-URI Too Large . 

ERROR 414 is thrown by Apache if the JIRA's request is too long. For example, we have KB at on how to fix the problem:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Long+URLs+Are+Rejected+by+Apache+with+%27Request-URI+Too+Large%27+Error

However, this workaround is not sufficient if the URL is very long exceeding 12392 bytes. 

Suggestions:
* since Activity Stream is using GET , change to POST request
fields.summary: Activity Stream sometime generate a very long request URL

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37906].
  {panel}

When using the Quick Search (I think you also refer to this as Free-text searching) it does not seem to search on the project name.

For instance I want to access a sales task for a particular client. I would search for "$clientName Sales". JIRA does not respond with this issue as it does not seem to search on the project name. In this case the project is called "Sales" and the task summary is "$clientName".

As stated here(https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+Quick+Search) JIRA seems to search on:

Summary
Description
Comments

I suggest adding Project Name to this list.
fields.summary: Quick search does not search on project name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37905].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Accessing a user profile, for example https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ViewProfile.jspa, takes a long period of time to return results. If it consistently causes timeouts the Activity Stream may ban it as a provider, meaning streams may no longer return results for a period of time.

h3. Environment

A larger instance for example 300,000 issues & 1000 projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Browse to a user's profile, for example https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ViewProfile.jspa.

h3. Expected Results

The results return quickly.

h3. Actual Results

The results take > 10 seconds to return so a timeout is encountered. The below is encountered in {{atlassian-jira.log}}:

{noformat}
[atlassian.streams.internal.StreamsCompletionService] Registering failure for stream provider JIRA due to cancellation (timeout)
{noformat}

h3. Timeouts

A timeout is triggered when the activity streams are not returned within the default timeout interval. This can be caused by any of the following:

* The JIRA instance is performing slowly when retrieving results (it may be under load or experiencing a performance problem).
* One of the providers in the stream is responding slowly.
* Something on the network layer is taking a long time.
* The index read speed may be slow (see our [Test the Disk Speed|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Testing+Disk+Access+Speed] KB)
* The provider may not be up and running.

h3. Notes

It is possible for certain Activity Stream providers (Atlassian apps or plugin-specific apps accessible through AppLinks) to be banned from returning results if they consistently time out. This bug fix alleviates some impact of that as it will reduce timeouts on the user profiles within JIRA. If a provider is banned, there is not currently any warning of this - the fix to that is tracked in [STRM-2264|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/STRM-2264].

Additionally more information can be found about timeout behaviours in [JIRA Activity Stream returns One or more activity sources were slow to respond and are not included|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Activity+Stream+returns+One+or+more+activity+sources+were+slow+to+respond+and+are+not+included].

h3. Workaround

Prior to Activity Streams 5.4.x, it's possible to modify the query string using a front-end proxy such as Apache to rewrite it to be higher. This addresses the symptom rather than the cause (which is the change history results take a long time to return from the database). Add the following to the Apache configuration:

{noformat}
    RewriteEngine on
    RewriteCond %{REQUEST_URI} ^/plugins/servlet/streams
    RewriteCond %{QUERY_STRING} !^timeout.*$
    RewriteRule ^(.*)$ %{REQUEST_URI}?timeout=20000&%{QUERY_STRING} [R,L]
{noformat}

If the provider has been banned, and is no longer returning results, either waiting > 24 hours or restarting the instance will address that problem.
fields.summary: Activity stream in the user profile times out easily on larger instances

fields.description:
I am running a JIRA installation on a Windows Azure server instance and I am facing the issue of having to delete the "work" directory *everytime* the server has restarted (mainly for maintenance by MSFT).

I see in the jira community / forums that many people face this issue and I believe that performing simple checks at startup to regenerate any corrupt files should save a significant amount of time and lessen the pain of having to manually login to the server, deleting working directory and restarting JIRA.
fields.summary: Startup issues every unclean shutdown

fields.description:
When attempting to add a new application link (for JIRA to Jenkins in this example), I enter the URL for our Jenkins instance (a qualified DNS address), but when the "Link applications" popup displays, it says:

You are creating a link from:

Application URL: http://localhost:8080/

Name: Jenkins

Application: Jenkins


Seemingly, it is ignoring the correct URL I am entering and replacing it with "http://localhost:8080/". The "to" details are correct:

To this application:

Application URL: http://xx.xxxx.xxx.xx:8080

Name: JIRA

Application: JIRA

where xxx is our correct JIRA DNS

If I attempt to continue with this, on the redirect to Jenkins to create the reciprocal link, it fails as the URL is redirects to begins with http://localhost:8080//plugins/servlet......etc.......
fields.summary: Creating a new application link uses localhost instead of provided url

fields.description:
h3. Symptoms

JIRA is not picking up the properties which an admin has entered in the  jira-config.properties file.

h3. Steps to repro

1. Go into the  jira-config.properties file and add:
{code}jira.search.views.default.max = 200{code}
2. Restart JIRA
3. Confirm the property in the System Info page
4. Go back to the file, and add a trailing whitespace as such:
{code}jira.search.views.default.max = 200 {code}
5. Restart JIRA
6. Confirm that the property is no longer seen in the System Info page

h3. Workaround

# Delete the extra space at the end of a line
# Restart JIRA
fields.summary: JIRA fails to parse jira-config.properties due to extra whitespace

fields.description:
While viewing issue in JIRA there is a link on the top that is 
project / epickey - epic name / storykey - story name

Case (say project x)
Created epic (say epic3) by cloning another epic say epic2
Subsequently changed issue type of epic3 to story (now it is story3)
Added epic link (say epic1) to story3

Now while viewing story 3 in JIRA the link should appear as
x / epic 1 / story 3

However, the link appears as 
x / story 3

Epic link is not seen in the link. I did check the data multiple times I do not see anything wrong in this.

I requested administrators to reindex the project and verified again. Still no change.
fields.summary: Problem in the issue link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37896].
  {panel}

*Feedback for customer:*

To restore the indexes, and jira-administrator, which is supposed to be up 24/7, had to login to jira via web AND SSH in order to find out the filename of the last know backup and to trigger a restore index, and one minute later to trigger a background reindex.

For such a feature to be effective the entire process must be automated. Once JIRA detects that the indexes are broken, it should try to restore last valid backup and do a background reindex after this succeeds.

If it can even send a message when this starts, ends is even better, but that would be an enhancement over the basic index recovery option.

Also, please note that I do find extremely counter-intuitive the fact that the restore index asks you about a filename instead of just showing you the latest available one (or a list of them.). This slows you down considerably as you need shell access to the machine to find-out the name of the archive.
fields.summary: Index Recovery should have an auto-recover functions when failure happen

fields.description:
When using a list in a description with sublist items normally the margin between those entries is really small. When adding a html-element in the list item containing sublist items the list has a quite big margin there.

Here is an example:

- A list
- with multiple
- item
-- and a sub-item
-- looks
-- good
- but *when* [Item A]
-- using some formatting [Item B]
-- the sublist items are misplaced

As you can see between Item A and Item B is now too much space. There is a css-tag which does not work in this case because the formatting of _when_ is in that case the first child.
 {code}ul:first-child { margin-top: 0; }{code}

Another thing is that in the preview of a post the list looks different than in the final post:

h3. Preview mode
_Big gap between last sub-list item and next list item._
!screenshot_210.png!

h3. Live mode
_Big gap between first sub-list item and corresponding list-item._
!screenshot_211.png!
fields.summary: Too much margin for sublist item in rich-text

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37876].
  {panel}

I have defined the following project categories:
- Products
- Libraries & Components
- Non-Code

The order above is the one I would like to see the categories. However, JIRA orders them alphabetically, resulting in:
- Libraries & Components
- Non-Code
- Products

Given that "Products" is the most important category to us, this is not satisfying. JRA-7528, despite being aimed at ordering projects instead of categories, mentions the workaround of putting spaces before the category names. This works, but clearly is too arcane and non-obvious. I think this deserves its own UI.

Please add the ability to manually order project categories on the respective administration page using up/down buttons. UI like this is not only present throughout JIRA, but is also pretty self-explanatory.

Note: I explicitly do *not* ask for manually ordering projects themselves; this is about project categories.
fields.summary: Ability to change order of project categories

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37873].
  {panel}

I have a workflow in JIRA OnDemand where each status has three to four outgoing transitions. JIRA only displays buttons for two transitions, hiding the others inside a "Workflow" dropdown. The choice seems really arbitrary.

The problem is that these transitions are easily overlooked by users not yet used to that workflow :-(. Furthermore, those who *do* know that there *are* additional transititions have to make one extra click to trigger them.

In regular JIRA, I could adapt the property {{ops.bar.group.size.opsbar-transitions}} to fix this, but I obviously can't do that in OnDemand.

Please consider adding UI for changing this.
fields.summary: Allow configuring "ops.bar.group.size.opsbar-transitions" in JIRA OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37872].
  {panel}

According to [Creating Issues and Comments from Email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email]: 
{quote}If an issue key is NOT found in the *subject*, the *in-reply-to header*  is examined:
* If the email message is found to be a reply to another email message from which an issue was previously created, the *body* is processed and added as a comment to that issue.
* If the email message is NOT found to be a reply, a new issue is created.{quote}

So if a user intends to create a new Issue by hitting Reply and changing the subject, the email is considered a comment and not a new issue by the handler.

Since the way external users send emails can't be controlled, using the In-Reply-To header prevents the creation of legitimate new issues. 

*Feature Request:*
Remove the check or add the possibility to choose the use of In-Reply-To header.
fields.summary: In-Reply-To header forces emails that should create new issues, to be added as comments
Update the JIRA Timesheet Plugin to version 2.7.9.1 in OnDemand

fields.description:
There's the code in {{share-dialog.js}} (added as a fix for JRA-27476),  which listens to the nearest scrollable parent and upon scroll, blurs whatever element is active at the time and hides the dialog. However, it doesn't check if Share Dialog has already been closed beforehand. So if it is closed and then the currently focused element is scrolled, it loses focus.

Reproduction sequence:
# Open Issue Navigator; use Detail View.
# Select some issue in the issue results list such that it doesn't fit vertically (scrollers are displayed).
# Click issue details so that focus is in the issue details panel.
# Click the "Share" button to open the Share dialog.
# Click issue details panel outside of the Share Dialog.
Observe: Share Dialog closes; the focus is in the issue details, as expected.
# Press Down arrow on the keyboard.
Observe: the details panel is scrolled.
# Press Down arrow on the keyboard again.
Observe: next issue is selected.
Expected: the details panel is scrolled.

This makes for a very strange and seemingly random focus behaviour.
fields.summary: Share dialog blurs focused component after it is closed
Would like to view more sprints on velocity report

Currently, when a user is removed from a connected LDAP directory, JIRA will check for historical items and do one of two things.

# Create a user and mark them as de-active if historical items are detected
# Remove the user if no history is found

fields.description:
When trying to use our JIRA instance we keep getting lots of
permissions errors which makes JIRA very difficult to use.  If we keep
trying then eventually it works. This has been happening for about the
last week or so.
 
It's very annoying as you keep having to enter the issues of the JIRA
you're trying to raise.  Then you get an error when you press "Create"
and so you have to start all over again and enter the details again.
It can often take 10 attempts to create the JIRA.

Sample error messages; 

XSRF Security Token Missing 

Your browser has not provided any parameters at all and your input has
been lost. Press back now to try and resend the data. This is most
likely caused by a bug in the browser. FireFox 3.6.0 have been known
to exhibit this behavior.  For more information see this bug report
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-20696 JIRA could not complete
this action due to a missing form token.

You may have cleared your browser cookies, which could have resulted
in the expiry of your current form token. A new form token has been
reissued.  Problematic action: CreateIssueDetails.jspa JIRA
administrators Please refer to this page for details on disabling form
token checking.
fields.summary: Users getting "XSRF Security Token Missing" when Creating Issues

fields.description:
When I press on "Create a new issue", I start filling out a LOT of information. it might be tons of text that describe what I found, and we have a large set of custom fields that let us understand where the bug is.
Then I might press escape (usually because I think that the computer is focused on another application, I have two monitors so that happens a lot) or just by mistake, and the dialog is closed without saving any of the data I wrote. 
I would expect that, if I've already entered any information, it will worn me and ask me if I am sure, similar to what google chrome does when you start filling a form and then navigate to another page.
This is also true to when resolving a bug. I once filled TONS of text and mistakenly pressed escape. it happens more than I would think, it happened 4 times today, and I just have to do things over and over again.

I tried to see if there is anything to solve this in the FAQ and couldn't find one, so sorry if there is already a solution for that.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37834].
  {panel}

Hello,
We have versions which are sometimes not released (not published, not distributed), but by customer or executive decision, this version is just skipped and won't be released.
But version have no "cancelled" state.
The only solution we have for this now is we set the version as released with a comment ("cancelled - not released"), then archive it ASAP.

We would like to be able to use something like "fixVersion is cancelledVersion()" in our search queries as we do with "releasedVersion()".
Could you add this state please ?
In fact, versions have more states like an (big) issue...

Looking forward to hear from you,
fields.summary: Sometimes a versions is not released but cancelled

The following set of Administration options: [^AdminOption.jpg] have their *Create* buttons aligned to the top-right corner, e.g. "Add Issue Type", "Add Subtask Issue Type", "Add Screen", "Add Screen Scheme" buttons are all aligned on the top-right corner.

Can't attach *.skp files, error (500)

This issue was reproduced at v6.1.3#6158-sha1:b5b5eab and at v6.3-ClusteringEAP06#6307-sha1:169338a

Reproducible Steps:
# Rename attached file cylinder.skb to cylinder.skp
# attempt to attach it to any jira issue

Jira reports the following error, when it should attach the file:
Cannot attach file cylinder.skp: Unknown server error (500).

*.skp files are scene files created by Google SketchUp and we use them in bug reports for our SketchUp plugin.
fields.summary: Can't attach *.skp files, error (500)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37823].
  {panel}

When creating a new issue the Cancel button is right next to the Add button and is far too easy to hit by accident, potentially losing a lot of work.

Please eliminate the Cancel button (or at least offer a preference so admins can eliminate it). It isn't really needed and it is far too dangerous.

For an example of a system that has no Cancel button try a Trac system. We used Trac for years and never missed having a Cancel button, nor did we ever lose any work to it.

The problem is exacerbated by having a preview mode (instead of using live preview, as Trac can do with a plugin); it is possible to think that Cancel will just leave preview mode. It has happened.

(An alternative that would be better than nothing is to move the Cancel button to the right edge, so it is far away from Add).
fields.summary: Please eliminate (perhaps optionally) the Cancel button
